snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include how much the government pays companies for wiretaps and access to e-mails, and a Google page that assembles...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include how much the government pays companies for wiretaps and access to e-mails, and a Google page that assembles autocomplete suggestions into a kind of poetry.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: The Cost of Surveillance, and Predictive Text Poetry
